page.title: 17PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: The sign of the{Saracen's Head}once depicted a turbanned Arab, but now it is plain & reads 'FREE HOUSE'.The property has recently been bought by the owners,who have been there for 3 generations. Children are grown up, & the sons work in Derby.All have no wish to move. The solid brick built house has 10 rooms & a cellar,which occasionally floods. The outbuildings, cowshed & stable date back to when it was a smallholding. There is a small private garden at the back & about 3/4acre in front dotted with picnic tables. Trade is seasonal. Beers, wine & spirits are supplied by 3 breweries: 2 from Burton & 1 from Leicester. Their competition ensures prices are reasonable. A pleasant friendly place, updated but stll retaining its country atmosphere.
